abstract: Life of Samuel J Battle, New York Police Dept's first black officer, who entered force in 1911, is chronicled in book One Righteous Man: Samuel Battle and the Shattering of the Color Line in New York by journalist Arthur Brown; book is based on manuscript written by  poet Langston Hughes.
lead_paragraph: The story of Samuel J. Battle, the first black officer in the New York Police Department, is being told in a new book by Arthur Browne, a veteran newspaper reporter and editor.

headline.main: The Story of New York’s First Black Police Officer, Told With the Help of Langston Hughes
headline.print_headline: Finishing What a Poet Left Undone
